feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 27 at 10:44PM AKST until December 29 at 3:00AM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...SNOW RETURNS TO HAINES AND THE HIGHWAY... .Light to moderate snow will return to Haines late tonight as a surface low lifts north through the Panhandle. Snow is expected through Thursday night before changing to rain Friday. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 3 AM THURSDAY TO 3 AM AKST FRIDAY...

entry.title: Air Quality Alert issued December 27 at 11:01AM PST by NWS
entry.summary: ...AIR QUALITY ALERT: MANDATORY WOOD-BURNING BAN IN EFFECT... The South Coast AQMD has extended a mandatory wood-burning ban for residents in the South Coast Air Basin for Wed Dec 27 through Thurs Dec 28. No-Burn days are declared to protect public health when levels of fine particle air pollution in the region are forecast to be high.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Orange County Coastal; Orange County Inland; Riverside County Mountains; San Bernardino and Riverside County Valleys-The Inland Empire; San Gorgonio Pass Near Banning

entry.title: Air Quality Alert issued December 27 at 10:53AM PST by NWS
entry.summary: ...AIR QUALITY ALERT IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT PST THURSDAY NIGHT... The South Coast AQMD has extended a mandatory wood-burning ban for residents in the South Coast Air Basin for Wed Dec 27th through Thurs Dec 28th. No-Burn days are declared to protect public health when levels of fine particle air pollution in the region are forecast to be high.

entry.title: Flood Warning issued December 27 at 8:58PM EST until further notice by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Florida... St Johns River Near Astor affecting Lake and Volusia Counties. .The St. Johns River at Astor remains in Minor Flood stage while continuing a very slow decline. The river is forecast to drop in to Action Stage early next week, but increasing northerly winds mid next week could cause levels to rise back into Minor Flood

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued December 28 at 5:43AM EST by NWS
entry.summary: ...Patchy Dense Fog This Morning... Areas of fog have developed and become dense in several areas as clouds have cleared out early this morning. A weak disturbance approaching from the southwest this morning should help lift and eventually dissipate the fog by 8 AM. If traveling, slow down, use low beam headlights, and allow extra

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued December 28 at 4:44AM EST by NWS
entry.summary: ...Patchy Dense Fog Likely This Morning... Areas of fog have developed and have become dense in several areas. As a band of clouds moves in from the west, the fog should lift and eventually dissipate in most locations by around 8 AM EST. If traveling, slow down, use low beam headlights, and allow extra time to reach your destination.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued December 28 at 3:17AM EST by NWS
entry.summary: ...Areas of Dense Fog This Morning... Areas of dense fog have developed earlier in the night, limiting visibilities to one quarter of a mile or less. The fog will gradually thin before dissipating after sunrise. If traveling, slow down, use low beam headlights, and allow extra time to reach your destination.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued December 28 at 4:41AM EST by NWS
entry.summary: The combination of decreasing clouds, light winds and moist soil conditions is allowing for the formation of locally dense fog, with visibilities at some locations down to a few hundred feet. Motorists are urged to drive with extreme caution by traveling at a lower speed and by maintaining extra separation distance with surrounding vehicles. Visibilities may remain poor in some areas
